title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 800.26 - Spark protector necessary
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 800.26 - Spark protector necessary

State Regulations

Every steam or donkey engine, when used upon any wharf or
landing, and every pile driver when working on or alongside any wharf, must
have upon its smokestack, a bonnet or spark catcher that will effectually
prevent sparks from falling upon such wharf or upon the deck of any
vessel. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
800.26

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
